contentfulBlogPost.title: The Rise of Individual Empowerment
contentfulBlogPost.seoDescription: SEO description IQPLUS! Post "Control - The Rise of Individual Empowerment"

content.value:
With the rise of platform companies like Airbnb and Uber the terms “sharing economy” and
“gig economy” has seen an upswing in popularity. Particularly in public debate and
legislators are trying to catch up with innovation. Much has been written about how it
affects work, taxation and the economy. As the internet matures new platforms have
emerged that challenge both the way we work, and how we make a living.

The nature of employment has changed. For people starting out their career the expectancy
is that you will switch jobs many times throughout your professional life. A gold watch after
40 years at the same company is no longer the ambition. We expect to be able to work
remotely and with more flexible hours. More people than ever before engage in freelancing.
In the U.S. as much as 43% of the workforce is projected to engage in freelance work in
2020 according to Nasdaq. The same trend can be observed in Europe where the number of
freelancers has increased drastically over the last decade. As we face less job security and
rapid technological change, opportunities to make money from various sources has become
increasingly popular and necessary.

Platforms that enable individuals to make money from their assets has truly revolutionized
how individuals can secure a separate income stream. Airbnb lets you earn money from
renting out a room or apartment and car sharing services like Turo and Nabobil let you rent
out your car when not in use.

Other platforms like Uber and Foodora let you do short time gigs at your convenience.
While freelancing platforms like Fiverr, PeoplePerHour and Amazon Mechanical Turk help
you find temporary gigs that fit your skills. Even the financial industry is seeing a rise in
individuals looking for alternate revenue. Peer-to-peer lenders like Prosper and Lending
Club lets individuals both borrow and lend money to and from one another.

They are all part of a movement to empower individuals to have more revenue streams in
times where a steady job is no longer the norm. People want to have more control of their
time and flexibility, side incomes allow this.

In a world that seems to be changing ever faster and where short-term employment is the
norm. Outshifting is the ultimate tool to help you achieve another revenue source and more
freedom. We aim to empower people to earn money by selling products they care about. In
essence anyone can be a sales channel. Instead of only recommending a product to a friend,
why not get a sales commission on it?
